message.content:
{
  "id": "15899",
  "title": "Bug 15899 - Close all saved does not always close the file when no changes have been made",
  "description": "When using build 20020508 with the latest UI code, the 'Close All Saved' option from the file menu does not always close the file even when no changes have been made.",
  "OB": "The 'Close All Saved' option should close the file when no changes have been made.",
  "EB": "The file remains open after selecting 'Close All Saved' from the file menu, even when no changes have been made to the file.",
  "SR": "To reproduce the issue:\n1. Use build 20020508 with the latest UI code.\n2. Open multiple file editors.\n3. Create a new file (e.g. f1.txt)\n4. Select 'Close All Saved' from the file menu.\n\nExpected result: The file f1.txt should be closed as no changes have been made.\nActual result: The file f1.txt remains open even when no changes have been made."
}
